item.title: NCP delegation joins meeting with CEC
item.description: A delegation of National Citizen Party (NCP) on Thursday joined a meeting with Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) AMM Nasir Uddin. A three-member delegation led by NCP Chief Coordinator Nasir Uddin Patwary joined the meeting with the CEC at his office at 3:40 pm. NCP Joint Convener Khaled Saifulla

item.title: Australian high commissioner meets Jamaat chief Shafiqur
item.description: Australian High Commissioner Susan Ryle has met with Jamaat-e-Islami Amir Shafiqur Rahman. She went to the Shafiqur’s office in Bashundhara at 9 am on Thursday. She was accompanied by Deputy High Commissioner Clinton Pobke, Political First Secretary Anna Peterson, and several other represent

item.title: RMG exports attain 4.79pc growth in July-September of FY26
item.description: The export of Ready-Made Garment (RMG) items showed a positive trend during the July-September period of the current fiscal year (FY26), fetching $9.97 billion, a marginal increase of 4.79%. According to the Export Promotion Bureau (EPB’s) recently published country-wise export data for Bang

item.title: New members appointed to board of Directors of Community Bank
item.description: Community Bank Bangladesh PLC is pleased to announce that Bangladesh Bank has approved the appointment of six new Directors and three Independent Directors to its Board, in accordance with regulatory requirements. According to the official notification, the newly appointed Directors are: Mr. A.K.M

item.title: Hungarian writer László Krasznahorkai wins Nobel Prize in literature
item.description: Hungarian writer László Krasznahorkai, whose philosophical, bleakly funny novels often unfold in single sentences, won the Nobel Prize in literature Thursday for his “compelling and visionary oeuvre.” Several works including his debut, “Satantango” a

item.title: EA locks and loads 'Battlefield 6' to take on 'Call of Duty' before going private
item.description: lectronic Arts (EA.O) is betting on the latest "Battlefield" title to do what the last one could not - restore the franchise's reputation and loosen the dominance of "Call of Duty" on the first-person shooter genre. item.title: Advisory Council approves 4 ordinances, one proposal
item.description: The Advisory Council on Thursday gave final and in principal approval to drafts of four ordinances and one proposal with Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus in the chair at his office. item.title: Bangladesh has only 465 psychiatrists for 40 million patients, roundtable told
item.description: FE ONLINE REPORT Bangladesh has just 465 psychiatrists to serve an estimated 40 million people suffering from mental health problems, speakers said at a roundtable in Dhaka city on Thursday. The discussion, held a day before World Mental Health Day 2025, urged immediate action to expand access to
